name: UAC (Unix-like Artifacts Collector)
description: UAC is a Live Response collection script for Incident Response that makes use of native binaries and tools to automate the collection of AIX, Android, ESXi, FreeBSD, Linux, macOS, NetBSD, NetScaler, OpenBSD and Solaris systems artifacts.
interact_justification: This is provided in the README.md file which is part of the software, and documentation on our website.
license_location_justification: Non-trivial license location file in repository: <https://github.com/tclahr/uac/blob/master/LICENSE>.
floss_license_justification: The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification: https://tclahr.github.io/uac-docs
repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_interim_justification: A development version/branch is available via GitHub (https://github.com/tclahr/uac). Release Candidate versions are released for testing and review before the final version.
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
release_notes_justification: Non-trivial release notes file in repository: <https://github.com/tclahr/uac/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md>.
release_notes_vulns_justification: When a vulnerability is found, we will announce this publically, and also in the changelog.
build_justification: No building is required, as everything is written in shell script.
test_justification: We created our own unit test which is publicly available at https://github.com/tclahr/uac-unit-test. Tests are automatically run via GitHub Actions before a Push and/or a Pull Request to master or develop branches.
test_policy_justification: We have a policy that changes require a separate branch that is then reviewed through a Pull Request and that it passes at least as many tests as before the change.
tests_are_added_justification: The process is to test any change before creating a Pull Request.
crypto_published_justification: UAC does not use any type of cryptography.
crypto_password_storage_justification: No passwords are used or stored.
static_analysis_justification: We use ShellCheck and strict mode (set -u) to test for code issues. As the code is written in shell script, most of the controls do not apply.
dynamic_analysis_justification: UAC is written in shell script. There are no direct input fields. Instead, we perform linting to find unexpected behavior.
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
english_justification: Project documentation can be found here: https://tclahr.github.io/uac-docs. Everything is done in English.
hardened_site_justification: // X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".
maintained_justification: This link https://github.com/tclahr/uac/graphs/commit-activity shows commits from multiple authors.

vulnerability_report_process_justificati: The security contacts for the repo are presented here - <https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/cluster-api-provider-aws/blob/main/SECURITY_CONTACTS>
vulnerability_report_private_justificati: The security contacts for the repo are presented here - <https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/cluster-api-provider-aws/blob/main/SECURITY_CONTACTS>
vulnerability_report_response_justificat: There has been no vulnerability report. Whatever dependabot alerts we get, are automated with GH Actions to mitigate the issue.
test_justification: Go unit/integrations/e2e tests within the core cluster-api-provider-aws repo
test_invocation_justification: "make test" and "make test-e2e" are being used. And also can be triggered via ginkgo.
test_policy_justification: Ensured by the maintainers and reviewers of the repo.
tests_documented_added_justification: Taken care in the PR templates.
warnings_justification: cluster-api-provider-aws uses many go linters and causes CI to fail if the linters don't pass.
warnings_fixed_justification: PRs won't pass CI until they are addressed.
know_secure_design_justification: We have security contacts in place - <https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/cluster-api-provider-aws/blob/main/SECURITY_CONTACTS>
know_common_errors_justification: We have security contacts in place - <https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/cluster-api-provider-aws/blob/main/SECURITY_CONTACTS>
crypto_published_justification: Uses TLS, SSH keygen, SSL, SHA etc. Can be found in documentation  - <https://cluster-api-aws.sigs.k8s.io/>
vulnerabilities_fixed_60_days_justificat: Dependabot GH Action runs every week to patch dependent package vulnerabilities - <https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/cluster-api-provider-aws/blob/main/.github/dependabot.yml>
vulnerabilities_critical_fixed_justifica: Dependabot GH Action runs every week to patch dependent package vulnerabilities - <https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/cluster-api-provider-aws/blob/main/.github/dependabot.yml>. If any exceptions, the maintainers do it manually.
static_analysis_justification: We run Go linters such as gosec, goconst, gofmt, goimports, etc. at every pull request.
static_analysis_fixed_justification: There have been no exploitable vulnerabilities detected yet
static_analysis_often_justification: We run Go linters such as gosec, goconst, gofmt, goimports, etc. at every pull request.
test_continuous_integration_justificatio: Runs on PRs and commits/merges to main, using GitHub Actions
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.

repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
version_unique_justification: Each release is marked in the form : release/x.x.x in the Linphone-SDK https://github.com/BelledonneCommunications/linphone-sdk/tree/release/5.1
version_tags_justification: Each release is tagged on the git repository
release_notes_justification: Non-trivial release notes file in repository: <https://github.com/BelledonneCommunications/linphone-sdk/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md>.
report_responses_justification: Belledonne Communications doesn't have the resources to follow and fix every bug reports submitted... Vulnerabilities are fixed in priority, and the other bugs after that (features requests and enhancements are in the bottom of the list). A big effort was done in the past year to at least give an answer to every new issue.
enhancement_responses_justification: Belledonne Communication has 18 employees, including 14 engineer, working on a full SIP stack, a media stack, an Android app, iOS app, desktop qt app (Windows, Mac, Linux), Yocto receipe, Flexisip SIP proxy, conference, presence servers, account-manager API and interface... Currently this is not possible to respond to the enhancement requests, because they often involves interoperability and weird scenarios...
report_archive_justification:
All issues from Github repositories are readable, and all the mails sent to the 3 mailing lists
https://lists.nongnu.org/archive/html/linphone-developers/
https://lists.nongnu.org/archive/html/linphone-users/
https://lists.nongnu.org/archive/html/flexisip-developers/
build_floss_tools_justification: All licences are available in the repositories used by the Linphone-SDK. By default, it is build with only FLOSS tools
know_common_errors_justification: The private wiki contains a coding style page with an emphasis on secure code, and how to avoid common security errors
crypto_published_justification: Linphone supports SRTP and ZRTP as-is
delivery_mitm_justification: SIPS use instead of plain SIP is recommended, but not enforced
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
hardened_site_justification: Found all required security hardening headers.
implementation_languages: CMake, Java, Perl, Objective-C, C++, C#, Batchfile, Shell, Qt Script, Makefile, C

name: tls-redirector
description: TLS Redirector is a tiny HTTP server written in Go that is designed to run on port 80 and redirect all incoming traffic to HTTPS. It does this by emitting a 301 Permanent Redirect where the scheme is simply replaced with "https".
description_good_justification: The opening paragraph describes the function of the software.
interact_justification: The project homepage explains both how to launch the software with Docker as well as how to build the software. Links are provided to the mailing list and issue tracker.
contribution_justification: This is covered by CONTRIBUTING.md, which explains that tls-redirector accepts both mailing list patches and GitHub pull requests: https://git.sr.ht/~ancarda/tls-redirector/tree/master/item/CONTRIBUTING.md
contribution_requirements_justification:
This project uses `gofumpt' for formatting, however that is not currently included in CONTRIBUTING.md

The project homepage does not link to CONTRIBUTING.md.
license_location_justification: The projects license is in LICENSE, a standard file name. Available here: https://git.sr.ht/~ancarda/tls-redirector/tree/master/item/LICENSE
floss_license_justification: The AGPL-3.0-or-later license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The AGPL-3.0-or-later license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_interface_justification:
The repository includes documentation on which environmental variables are supported. The program has no output when running successfully.

* README: https://sr.ht/~ancarda/tls-redirector/#configuration
* Man page: https://git.sr.ht/~ancarda/tls-redirector/tree/master/item/doc/tls-redirector.8
repo_public_justification: Yes. The project uses version control, accessible to the public at this URL: https://git.sr.ht/~ancarda/tls-redirector
repo_interim_justification: All work, including in-progress work, is pushed to the master branch on a regular basis.
repo_distributed_justification: The project uses Git.
version_unique_justification: Each version intended for end-users has a unique Git tag that follows Semantic Versioning: https://git.sr.ht/~ancarda/tls-redirector/refs
version_tags_justification: Versions are identified via Git tags.
release_notes_justification: Each version includes release notes that explain what has changed since the previous version: https://git.sr.ht/~ancarda/tls-redirector/refs
release_notes_vulns_justification: This project has never had a known security vulnerability.
report_process_justification:
Bugs can be reported on the mailing list ~ancarda/tls-redirector@lists.sr.ht

Archives are available here: https://lists.sr.ht/~ancarda/tls-redirector/
report_archive_justification: Mailing list archives are available here: https://lists.sr.ht/~ancarda/tls-redirector/
vulnerability_report_process_justificati: CONTRIBUTING.md includes a private email address for security reports: https://git.sr.ht/~ancarda/tls-redirector/tree/master/item/CONTRIBUTING.md
vulnerability_report_private_justificati: CONTRIBUTING.md includes a private email address for security reports: https://git.sr.ht/~ancarda/tls-redirector/tree/master/item/CONTRIBUTING.md
vulnerability_report_response_justificat: This project has never had a known security vulnerability.
build_common_tools_justification: No external tools, packages, or libraries are required to build tls-redirector. The only dependency is a Go compiler and standard library
build_floss_tools_justification: The only build dependency is a Go compiler and standard library. The standard library and reference compiler are licensed under BSD-3-Clause.
test_invocation_justification: Tests are executed via `go test', which is a standard invocation for Go projects.
warnings_justification: This is currently done informally via Go Report Card, however it should be included in the CI pipeline.
delivery_mitm_justification: Not Applicable. This project communicates exclusively over HTTP, by design.
delivery_unsigned_justification: Not Applicable. This project communicates exclusively over HTTP, by design.
vulnerabilities_fixed_60_days_justificat: This project has never had a known security vulnerability.
vulnerabilities_critical_fixed_justifica: This project has never had a known security vulnerability. Should one be reported, it will take priority over other issues.
static_analysis_often_justification: CI currently does not currently run any code quality tools, aside from the unit tests.
test_continuous_integration_justificatio: Yes. All commits pushed to master triggers a build process that runs unit tests: https://builds.sr.ht/~ancarda/tls-redirector
discussion_justification: This project uses SourceHut mailing lists for discussions, which enables contributions via a standard email client. Archives can be browsed and searched here: https://lists.sr.ht/~ancarda/tls-redirector/ via a standard web browser, without having to run proprietary JavaScript. The entire archive can also be downloaded in a standard format (mbox) and thus processed entirely with client-side free software.
no_leaked_credentials_justification: Credentials related to this project are not known to have ever leaked. However, there is no way to ensure this is kept in compliance.
english_justification: All documentation and project communication is in English.
hardened_site_justification: SourceHut is currently not in compliance as it lacks many key security headers: https://securityheaders.com/?q=https%3A%2F%2Fgit.sr.ht%2F%7Eancarda%2Ftls-redirector&hide=on&followRedirects=on // X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".
internationalization_justification: The error page is not currently possible to translate without modifying the source code and recompiling.
sites_password_security_justification: The project website does not store credentials because all resources are accessible without authentication.
maintenance_or_update_justification: All versions are kept forever and can always be pulled from Git.
external_dependencies_justification: Dependencies are managed through Go Modules: https://git.sr.ht/~ancarda/tls-redirector/tree/master/item/go.mod
signed_releases_justification: All releases are signed, however it's with a key listed in CONTRIBUTING and this relationship is not clear enough
version_tags_signed_justification: Every commit in the project repository has been signed with PGP, going back to the initial commit. As of version 2.0, Git tags are also signed with PGP: https://git.sr.ht/~ancarda/tls-redirector/refs
require_2FA_justification: The maintainer has Two Factor Authentication enabled on both SourceHut and GitHub (mirror). Neither is setup to use SMS.
secure_2FA_justification:
SourceHut does not support the use of SMS for Two Factor Authentication.

The GitHub mirror is not configured to use SMS.
code_review_standards_justification: CONTRIBUTING.md does not provide this information. Among other things, it does not explain how to run tests, static analysis tools, or the code formatter.
test_statement_coverage90_justification: Coverage is currently 69.1%. Tests are run in CI, however coverage is not kept at 90%.
test_branch_coverage80_justification: Coverage is currently 69.1%. Tests are run in CI, however coverage is not kept at 80%.
